Name: ABC
column8: <ref name="ipv6announcebug" group=Note>Announcements to the tracker are made via IPv6 if possible  but the client doesn't listen on the respective port.</ref>

Name: BitComet
Latest stable software release: <ref>BitComet command line interface see BitComet Command Line – BitComet Wiki</ref>

Name: BitTorrent client
Software license: Preload Magnet metadata <ref name="preload_magnet_metadata" group=Note>For a torrent added from a Magnet link  obtain the list of files (and other metadata) before prompting the user for a download location.</ref>
Year (not dynamic but easier for sortin: UPnP <ref name="upnp" group="Note">Automatically configure port forwarding (requires Router with UPnP support)</ref>
column8: NAT traversal <ref name="udp_nat" group="Note">Many clients claim to support this  but just UPnP calls for opening a TCP port is not effective and disabled by factory default in most new hardware. "UDP NAT Traversal" is the proper working solution  supported by just a few.</ref>
column9: DHT <ref name="dht" group="Note">DHT permits use of trackerless torrents (with supporting clients) to resume normal torrents when their tracker is down. However  some trackers that register their users for keeping tabs on fair usage (such as a ratio of bytes downloaded to uploaded) may not reliably measure and update usage for users employing DHT.</ref>

Name: BitTornado
Operating system: <ref name="linuxtracker" group=Note>Tracker included with Linux binaries and with source  but not with Windows binary.</ref>

Name: BitTorrent 6
column10: <ref name="exchange" group=Note>Exchanging with BT 6 and μTorrent clients (and now MooPolice).</ref>

column8: <ref group=Note>It's UDP based  an experimental feature and only supported by other Azureus based clients.</ref>
column9: <ref name="dht_not_compatible" group=Note>Has its own DHT  a mainline-DHT compatible implementation is available as plugin.</ref>

column9: <ref group=Note>μTorrent's DHT implementation is the same as Mainline and BitComet's  but unfortunately this is incompatible with Azureus's implementation.</ref>

Name: Shareaza
column9: <ref group=Note>Since Shareaza v2.6.0.0  Shareaza includes Mainline DHT support. Also  Shareaza can use the Gnutella2 network to find other Gnutella2 clients sharing the same torrent. This also includes clients who do not actively seed the torrent in question anymore  as long as file hashes (such as sha1 for example) are known.</ref>
